CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 4, 1964, pg. 11 reads: "Push Seagram's Sales - Frank Cepits (Right)< Western Pennsylvania manager, Seagram's Distillers Co., discusses fine progress of current gin sales, with Bob French, representative of the firm in this area. Launched in June, the Seagram's gin campaign in now in full stride.  Frank and Bob suggest that clients use Seagram's gin on the rocks, and likewise as a mix.  Seagram's also bottles VO-Seven Crown, and Crown Royal, for discriminating imbibers.  All labels are available in state stores, and Royal Crown is a "must" for those who demand the ultimate in fine whiskey."
TitMainTitle: Sales representative Robert "Bob" P. French Jr. and regional manager Frank Cepits standing behing Seagram's gin display with dancing bears, in interior with flecked linoleum floor
